parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The overheating of the Level 2 charging port can cause charging to stop or slow down, leading to longer charging times, inconvenience, and potentially unsafe circumstances, such as running out of power in cold weather.
symptoms: The vehicle stops charging after a certain period
the vehicle requires manual intervention to restart charging
the charging port may overheat within 30-60 minutes of use.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inadequate Software Patch for Level 2 Charging
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The software patch released by Hyundai/Genesis to detect overheating and throttle the amperage does not resolve the physical hardware issue, leaving the vehicle in an unsafe operating posture.
symptoms: The software patch does not address the underlying hardware issue

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The 12-volt battery issue can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to unsafe conditions, such as loss of acceleration and inability to maintain speed.
symptoms: The vehicle reports a 12-volt battery issue
the vehicle may maintain a slow speed

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Power Train Failure (Unintended Acceleration and Loss of Motive Power)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The power train failure can cause unintended acceleration, loss of motive power, and difficulty shifting gears, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: transmission failure to shift into park
and failure of the Auto Start/Stop button.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The delay in recall service can leave the vehicle in an unsafe condition, potentially leading to accidents or other safety issues.
symptoms: and the manufacturer or dealer confirms the delay.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The transmission failure can cause difficulty shifting gears, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: and difficulty shifting into intended gear.
